title:
A free field approach to $\widehat{g}_{k}$ and parafermionic
  $\widehat{g}_{k}/\widehat{u(1)}^{r}$ Ishibashi states
abstract:
In a recent work \cite{Liu:2023gzf}, I proposed a method to challenge the
calculations of genus-$g$, bulk $n$-point, $b$-boundary, $c$-crosscap functions
with $x$ boundary operators $\mathcal{F}_{g,n,b,c}^{x}$ of two-dimensional
conformal field theories (CFT$_2$) by expanding them as infinite linear
combinations of genus-$g$, $(n+b+c)$-point bulk correlation functions. Applying
free field resolutions of chiral modules is an effective method for obtaining
infinite linear coefficients in the expansion. We review free field resolution
conjectures of dominant irreducible $\widehat{g}_{k}$ highest-weight modules
and higher-rank parafermionic $\widehat{g}_{k}/ \widehat{u(1)}^{r}$ modules
\cite{Bouwknegt:1989xa, Bouwknegt:1990fb, Bouwknegt:1990wa}, and apply them to
corresponding Ishibashi states.
